text: The Slovakia women's national under-18 and under-19 is a national basketball team of Slovakia and is governed by the Slovak Basketball Federation. It represents Slovakia in international under-19 and under-18 (under age of 19 and under age of 18) women's basketball competitions. ==Championships results== ===FIBA U18 Women's European Championship=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |- !Year !width="150"|Position |- | 1994||6th |- |style="border: 3px solid red"| 1996|| |- | 1998|| |- | 2000||12th |- | 2002||4th |- |style="border: 3px solid red"| 2004||11th |- | 2005||8th |- | 2006||13th |- | 2007||9th |- | 2008||7th |- | 2009||14th |- |style="border: 3px solid red"| 2010||9th |- | 2011||14th |- | 2012||9th |- | 2013||14th |- | 2014||— |- | 2015||1st in Division B |- | 2016||15th |- | 2017||12th in Division B |- | 2018||14th in Division B |- | 2019||10th in Division B |} ===FIBA Under-19 Women's Basketball World Cup=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |- !Year !width="150"|Position |- | 1993||DNQ |- | 1997|| |- | 2001||DNQ |- | 2005||DNQ |- |style="border: 3px solid red"| 2007||6th |- | 2009||DNQ |- | 2011||DNQ |- | 2013||DNQ |- | 2015||DNQ |- | 2017||DNQ |- | 2019||DNQ |- | 2021||DNQ |- | 2023||TBD |} ==See also== * Slovakia women's national basketball team ==References== under Category:Women's national under-19 basketball teams
